programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Choux farcis et salade de pommes de terre à la salicorne
programme.desc: Stuffed cabbage and potato salad with samphire Arnaud Marchand is about to change the way you see cabbage, forever, as he cooks stuffed cabbage with shredded ribs, accompanied by a potato salad with samphire. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Millau, where a viaduct sets the scene Sophie Jovillard is off to explore Millau and its famous viaduct. This monumental structure, famous around the world for its elegant design and pure clean lines, has become part of French heritage. Renowned for the delicate finesse of its architecture, it's a construction that broke all the records. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken pizzas and a honey-miso salmon bowl
Two recipes for easy meals that don't compromise on taste: chicken pizza on butter naan bread and a quick honey-miso marinated salmon bowl.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Les routes de l'impossible
programme.desc:
Armenia, the resistants of the Caucasus

At the crossroads of Asia and Europe, Armenia appears as an inaccessible fortress. 90% of its territory is over 1,000 metres above sea level and whole villages were completely devastated by an earthquake in 1988. Arman and his father confront the snow-covered trails to deliver provisions to the villagers.

Directed by: Julien Boluen, Jean-Christophe Brisard (France, 2019)

programme.title: Les petites bulles
programme.desc: From tadpole to frog What is a frog? Where does it live? And what was it before it became a frog?

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
Better together
Today, Rocky is going to discover the meaning of solidarity. Everyone has come to his aid, to help him find Frog, the sticker he loves on the underground ticket machines.
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Bonne mère
programme.desc:
Nora, a cleaner in her fifties, watches over her little brood on a housing estate in northern Marseille. She worries about what is going to happen to her grown-up son Ellyes, in preventive custody for several months, and awaiting his trial for robbery with a mixture of hope and worry.

Directed by: Hafzia Herzi (France, 2016)

Cast: Halima Benhamed, Sabrina Benhamed, Jawed Hannachi Herzi

Genre: Dramedy

Awards: Official selection for ''Un Certain Regard'' (Cannes 2021)

programme.title: Capitaine Marleau
programme.desc:
In the name of the son
A train driver is found dead. Five years earlier, he had caused the death of a teenager in a car accident. A revenge killing? Marleau suspects Father Damien; not only does he know all the local secrets, but was personally involved in the previous case.
Directed by: Josée Dayan (season 3, France, 2020) Screenplay by: Marc Eisenchteter, Christian François Cast: Corinne Masiero (Inspector Marleau), Olivier Gourmet (Father Damien), Anouk Grinberg (Roxane Girard), Grégoire Colin (Bertrand Lanski), Jeanne Cherhal (Violette Lanski), Arthur Mazet (Bonnet), Fatou N'Diaye (Nathalie Esposito), Yves Lecoque (the bishop) Genre: thriller

programme.title: Alice Guy, l'inconnue du 7ème art
programme.desc:
Who has heard of Alice Guy (1873-1968)? The name of this Frenchwoman was erased from the history of cinema, even before her death. A thousand films, a career that spanned both sides of the Atlantic, she was the first woman director, scriptwriter, producer and studio director. Portrait of a pioneer.

Directed by: Nathalie Masduraud, Valérie Urrea (France, 2021)

Narrated by: Agnès Jaoui, Maud Wyler.

programme.title: Alain Resnais, l'audacieux
programme.desc:
An eccentric, disconcerting film-maker, brilliant inventor of new styles. In the shadows of the New Wave, Alain Resnais (1922-2014) left an indelible mark on European cinema. "On Connaît la Chanson", "L'Année Dernière à Marienbad", "Hiroshima Mon Amour"... A look back at the career of a discreet nonconformist.

Directed by: Pierre-Henri Gibert (France, 2022)

programme.title: Les beaux malaises 2.0
programme.desc: Episode 9: Florence's 18th birthday It's Florence's birthday. The family has organised a mega party and invited absolutely everyone... Unfortunately they've invited far too many people for things to go as planned! Directed by: Robin Aubert (Canada, 2020) Screenplay: Martin Matte Cast: Martin Matte (Martin), Julie Le Breton (Julie), Michèle Deslauriers (Monique), Patrice Robitaille (Patrick), Martin Perizzolo (Jean-François), Édouard Tremblay-Grenier (Léo), Émilie Bierre (Florence) Genre: comedy

programme.title: Les beaux malaises 2.0
programme.desc: Episode 10: Dilemma Audrey is ready to move in with Martin. But now it comes down to it, Martin is less and less certain: after all this new commitment will put a definite end to his relationship with Julie and their life as a family life. He's going to have to choose, but how? Directed by: Robin Aubert (Canada, 2020) Screenplay: Martin Matte Cast: Martin Matte (Martin), Julie Le Breton (Julie), Michèle Deslauriers (Monique), Patrice Robitaille (Patrick), Martin Perizzolo (Jean-François), Édouard Tremblay-Grenier (Léo), Émilie Bierre (Florence) Genre: comedy

programme.title: Une autre histoire
programme.desc:
Episode 1
On the same day that Anémone receives her diagnosis of early-onset Alzheimer's she also has to cope with the arrival of a new director at the funeral parlour where she works as an embalmer. Shaken, she has no idea how to announce the illness to friends and family.
Directed by: Brigitte Couture (Canada, 2019) Cast: Marina Orsini (Anémone), Danielle Proulx (Lise), Sébastien Ricard (Vincent), Debbie Lynch-White (Caroline), Benoît McGinnis (Sébastien), Adam Kosh (Jean-Olivier), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Simon), Marilou Morin (Karla), Laurence Barrette (Olivia) Genre: drama

programme.title: Sibovoyage
programme.desc: From Tangier to Rabat (Morocco) Totally transformed over a very short period of time: Tangiers and Rabat, two of Morocco's must-visit cities, successfully crossed into the 21st century and positioned themselves as the cultural avant-garde of North Africa, whilst losing none of their ancient charm and the attraction of their seaside. Directed by: Thierry Perouse, Sabine de Heaulme (Belgium, 2019)

programme.title: Le mystère Bardot
programme.desc:
Who hides behind Brigitte Bardot? Extraordinarily photogenic, a tumultuous love life, the ultimate sex symbol for the 1950s and 1960s, the actress, singer and animal rights activist left an indelible mark on her era. Despite over 30,000 photos published in the press, her true personality has long-remained in the shadows.

Directed by: Sophie Agacinski, Gilles Nadeau (France, 2012)

programme.title: Un si grand soleil
programme.desc: Épisode 345 Les Gimenez semblent avoir trouvé une nouvelle façon de parvenir à leurs fins. Quant à Élizabeth, va-t-elle suivre ses envies ? Réalisation : Jérôme Portheault, Marion Lallier, Yannick Saillet, David Durca (saison 2, France, 2019) Distribution : Chrystelle Labaude (Élizabeth), Moïse Santamaria (Manu), Mélanie Robert (Manon), Naïma Rodric (Lucille), Aïssam Medhem (Akim), Shirley Bousquet (Laëtitia), Léonie Dahan-Lamort (Camille), Hubert Benhamdine (Christophe), Mathilde Jaillette (Johanna), Folco Marchi (Ludo), Benjamin Bourgois (Alex), Mélanie Maudran (Claire), Maëlle Mietton (Alice), Jérémy Banster (Julien) Genre : comédie dramatique

programme.title: TV5MONDE, le journal Afrique
programme.desc: All the African news from the TV5MONDE news staff.
